items.title: Remote HR Automation Engineer
items.content:
A telecommunications services provider is searching for a person to fill their position for a Remote HR Automation Engineer. Core Responsibilities of this position include: Designing and implementing dialog management (ChatBot processes) Designing and implementing Robotic Process Automation (RPA) Discovering and facilitating RPA opportunities within current HR processes Position Requirements Include: Degree in related field or equivalent experience 1-2 years of applicable ChatBot and/or RPA development experience 6-8 years of IT/HR systems experience Demonstrate an understanding of HR data Advanced experience with SharePoint, PowerPoint and Excel Strong database management skills with the ability to merge, clean and analyze large amounts of data

SDL2017

items.title: Clinical Recruiter
items.content:
Remote

at Nurx

Remote

Nurx is on a mission to change the way healthcare is delivered, making it more accessible and affordable for patients, nationwide. With a specialty in sensitive health, we have built the industry-leading telehealth platform that spans consultation, diagnoses and fulfillment (right to your door). We are committed to revolutionizing the healthcare industry and that’s where you come in!

Today we have more than 250,000 patients, are growing 90% year-over-year, and operate in 29 states. We are lucky to count Kleiner Perkins and Union Square Ventures as investors and Chelsea Clinton and Regina Benjamin as Board Members.

About the job:

Nurx is looking for an experienced Clinical Recruiter to join our People Team. This is a remote position.With a primary focus on filling clinical roles (FTE and IC) throughout the Nurx organization. You’ll source, screen and coordinate candidates through our interview pipeline. We hire full-time licensed RNs for our Miami office, and independently contract NPs, PAs and MDs licensed in various states. Full life-cycle recruiting of clinical professionals including: RN, NP, PA and MD. May also jump in to assist recruiting efforts outside the Clinical organization from time to time.

What You’ll Do:

  • Establish, build and maintain relationships with both hiring managers and candidates
  • Create a high quality pipeline of candidates by various outreach efforts, including via emails, high volume of calls, ATS, Linkedin and other employment sources daily
  • Build a pipeline of candidates utilizing the company’s ATS (Greenhouse) and all other resources
  • Initiate creative strategies to recruit active and passive candidates
  • Extend offers and negotiate compensation contracts
  • Coordinate candidates through the interview pipeline
  • Multitask in a fast paced environment and manage candidate phone calls, email communication and coordination between candidates and hiring team
  • Manage tasks within a deadline oriented environment
  • Assist with other recruiting activities, projects and tasks as delegated and needed

A bit about you:

  • Experience with Greenhouse ATS
  • 3+ years track record of successfully filling clinical jobs
  • Experience filling MD, nursing and other clinical roles is required
  • Excellent communication skills to interact with prospective and existing candidates to discuss assignment details, pay, and hand holding through joining date
  • Must have a high sense of urgency and self-confidence while working in a results-oriented environment
  • Excellent people friendly skills and ability to attract and interact with prospective and existing clients to describe job assignment details, pay, and benefits

Benefits:

  • Talented and collaborative team who will both support and challenge you.
  • Market competitive salary and equity.
  • Medical, dental, commuter, and wellness benefits.
  • 401(k) retirement plan.
  • Paid holiday, vacation, and sick leave.
  • Take what you need vacation (and we really mean it!).

This position is a full-time remote position, or can be based out of our Miami, FL office (no relocation offered).

Apply for job

items.title: HR Recruiter/Manager
items.content:
BuddyBoss

HR Recruiter/manager

verified
Worldwide
**Company Overview** At BuddyBoss, we help organizations and individuals sell courses, memberships and build online communities. We are passionate about helping our customers succeed. We provide them with the web technology, mobile app technology and a range of “done for you” services, to help them succeed in building their online platforms and businesses. We have strong work ethics, we love to build cool stuff and we have a strong focus on our customers’ experience. **Responsibilities** * Handle Employee On-boarding and Off-boarding * Collect new hire information and submit relevant information to payroll; * Prepare and post employee announcements * Prepare and post job postings for all new positions for our multiple locations * Handle initial candidate screenings, and coordinate with other team members and management for interviews * Help implement new and improve existing processes * Act as a resource person/point of contact for all employees concerning any question related to HR and Benefits * Prepare all types of letters: new hire, transfer, promotion, change of status, departure/termination, parental leaves, retirement confirmation and employment verification letters * Ensure that the new hire orientation process properly introduces new employees to the company culture * Work with senior leadership to develop and implement HR policies and procedures. * Conduct follow-ups and other actions related to probationary period, vacation days/hours, new hires and status changes; * Coordinating training sessions with other employees, preparing organizational charts, maintaining employee records. **Qualifications** * Post-secondary degree or diploma in related field * Minimum 3 years of human resources experience in a generalist capacity and 2-3 years in recruiting * Experience in the IT industry * Experience hiring IT talent in North American, European and Asian markets will be considered an asset * Experience working in a distributed company will be considered an asset * Demonstrated professionalism with proven ability to handle confidential information * Excellent oral and written communication skills and strong interpersonal abilities * Demonstrated initiative and drive * An approachable personality * Excellent ability to “read” people yagJzhkdapAsCMnUw7CpJAMi #Location - Worldwide

items.title: Talent Acquisition Specialist
items.content:
Remote
  • Job Location(s) US-Work From Home
  • Job ID
    • 2020-10338
  • LCAT
    • Recruiter 2
  • Work Status
    • Full-Time Regular

Job Description

KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  1. Collaborates with hiring managers to create and review employment requisitions and develop staffing plans.
  2. Communicates with hiring manager on the status of requisitions, candidate quality and candidate pipeline.
  3. Reviews and analyzes resumes using company’s applicant tracking system
  4. Evaluates candidate’s employment factors such as job experience, education and training, skills, knowledge and abilities.
  5. Arranges management interviews.
  6. May participate with management to develop job specifications, make salary recommendations and negotiate starting salary.

Why Salient CRGT?

We’re passionate about the inspirational missions of our customers and we entrust our employees and teams to deliver exceptional performance to enable the safety, security, health and well-being of our nation. We provide the tools and resources to help you be successful, and our culture fosters an environment in which idea sharing and collaboration is essential. Are you ready to make a difference?

Required Qualifications

  • 2-4 yrs of professional experience in staffing, sourcing, recruiting
  • AS
  • Ability to work independently
  • Strong persuasive abilities, sound judgment, and a sense of urgency
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills and ability to work with all levels of staff
  • Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines and respond quickly and appropriately to departmental staffing needs
  • Quick learner
  • able to multitask and manage multiple requisitions for various programs

Desired Qualifications

Salient CRGT is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other factor prohibited by applicable anti-discrimination laws.

items.title: HR Coordinator
items.content:
Remote

Location: Tustin, CA or Remote Location

Position Summary:

Responsible for administration and maintenance of the HR activities and programs. Responsible for answering employee questions, assisting in new hire orientations, HR events, as well as supporting regional HR Generalist.

Responsibilities:

  • Records employee information such as personal data, compensation, benefits, tax data, attendance, performance reviews or evaluations, and separation date and reason.
  • Updates employee files to document personnel actions and to provide information for payroll and other uses.
  • Personnel Status Change (PSC’s)
  • IT Notices/Staff Changes
  • Process Resignations Paperwork and Follow-up
  • Birthday and Anniversary Cards, Emails and Reports
  • Maintain Employee Files
  • Manage New Hire Onboarding process
  • ADP Entries
  • ADP Portal Administration and Updates
  • Job Function Reporting
  • Manage Time Cards
  • Work on Special Projects
  • Assist HR Generalist
  • VOE’s
  • Tickets as assigned
  • Complete Timelines and Outlines as requested
  • Other Duties and Projects as assigned

Required Skills

  • Recent Experience as a Human Resources Assistant, Human Resources Coordinator or equivalent.
  • Possesses strong attention to detail, time management skills and the ability to multitask in a fast paced, demanding environment.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, and Access), ADP WorkforceNow, and various background check systems.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.

Education/Experience:

  • Associate degree (AA.) or equivalent from two-year College or technical school; or six months to one-year related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Work Authorization: Must be able to verify identity and employment eligibility to work in the U.S.

Other Duties: This job profile is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of job duties and responsibilities, as one may perform additional related duties as assigned in order to meet the needs of the organization.

Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Must be able to lift up to ten pounds. Primary functions require sufficient physical ability and mobility to work in an office setting; to stand or sit for prolonged periods of time; to occasionally stoop, bend, kneel, crouch, reach, and twist; to lift, carry, push, and/or pull light to moderate amounts of weight; to operate office equipment requiring repetitive hand movement and fine coordination including use of a keyboard; and to verbally communicate to exchange information. VISION: See in the normal visual range with or without correction. HEARING: Hear in the normal audio range with or without correction.

Apply for job

items.content:
Remote

About Sitka

Sitka provides doctors and patients on-demand access to our network of specialists through our unique technology platform. With Sitka, patients receive personalized video reviews of their medical data from experts. Our platform allows patients and their doctors to consult with specialists easily and quickly, usually with turnarounds of hours instead of weeks.

We believe meaningful improvement in medicine requires new systems enabling convenient, conversational workflows between patients and their physicians, not tedious and documentation-heavy processes. As such, we integrate our platform deeply into complicated health systems so that providers can leverage our specialists easily and make better clinical decisions over video.

As a small, fully-remote startup, there are no big-company cog-in-the-machine roles. Everything and everyone matters, so we hire with that in mind. We value diversity, not just because building services for diverse populations requires a diverse team, but because we personally feel it’s the right thing to do.

About the job

Sitka engineers progressively bring order to the chaos of medicine. We work closely with our clinical practitioners and patients, rapidly iterating on the product and workflow to solve real problems in real clinics.

The platform we build serves patient, primary care, and specialist workflows in friendly-yet-compliant ways while providing robust tools around synchronous and asynchronous video and annotation. Sitka is a modern API-based web application — we use React to build our user-facing front-end, Python for our back-end web services, and we deploy containerized services to AWS.

You’d report to the CTO on a fully-remote team with tremendous flexibility to define the shape of the product, technical architecture and company itself. As an early engineer, you will be a critical member of the team, with your work directly affecting the success or failure of the company. The scope of your potential impact is limited only by your ambition and ability to get things done.

Requirements

  • You are a seasoned software engineer that enjoys writing Python, and have at least 3 years of experience doing so.
  • You’ve designed and implemented complicated data architectures for a real-world service in either RDBMS or NoSQL storage systems (or both for extra points).
  • You understand modern web architecture – how the pieces fit together, how to build robust and reliable services, how to manage complexity as a service grows.
  • You like learning new things, teaching what you know to others and generally aren’t a jerk about it.
  • You’re capable of solving whole problems with lots of ambiguity. We’re a startup doing things that nobody has done before. This means building things with imperfect information and building for adaptation when your assumptions are wrong. It’s not for everyone.
  • You care about building an engineering culture based on diversity, respect, recognition and trust.

Extra credit!

  • You’re a senior engineer. If you have 15+ years of experience building complex systems, great!
  • You’ve worked on complicated, multiparty workflow systems.
  • You’ve dealt with HIPAA and survived with your sanity intact (intactness of sanity is strictly optional).
  • You’ve built systems on AWS.
  • You’ve worked on streaming video.

Location: US Locations Only

Apply for job

items.title: Recruiting Coordinator
items.content:
Remote | Part-time
  • REMOTE
  • PEOPLE OPS
  • PART-TIME

Elevate Labs is on a mission to improve people’s minds.

The ability to write well and speak eloquently deeply affects your trajectory in life, regardless of profession. Unfortunately, many people leave high school and even college extremely unprepared in these areas. We developed our flagship mobile app, Elevate, to help bridge this gap, through 35 games (and more on the way) that teach concrete cognitive skills. Elevate has over 30 million downloads and has received numerous accolades, including Apple’s App of the Year award.

The Elevate app was just the beginning. We’ve recently launched Balance, a personalized meditation app, that helps people with their stress, sleep, focus, and much more. It’s a truly customized experience that makes meditation more accessible to millions of people.

Join us in creating the future of products that help people live healthy, joyful, and productive lives.

As our Recruiting Coordinator, you will be the face of Elevate Labs for all of our candidates. You will be responsible for ensuring each candidate has an excellent experience and is left with a positive impression.

You will be primarily responsible for managing and executing all day-to-day tasks related to recruitment coordination. Using your recruiting expertise, you will also help us refine and streamline our recruitment processes, and work on strategic recruiting related projects (sourcing, pipeline management, candidate experience, recruiting metrics, etc.).

This position is a part-time (20-25 hrs/week), fully remote role, with the potential to convert to full time. Candidates from anywhere in the US are encouraged to apply.

About the role

    • Project manage interview preparation with hiring managers
    • Communicate directly with candidates
    • Schedule pitch calls, tech screens, and interviews via our ATS platform, Lever
    • Assist in sourcing qualified candidates
    • Support pipeline management
    • Partner with hiring managers to improve our recruiting processes
    • Determine and execute strategic projects to improve the ongoing candidate and hiring manager experience

We’d love to hear from you if you…

    • Are excited to scale and improve a startup’s recruitment operation
    • Have experience using Lever or another ATS
    • Have a passion for providing an amazing candidate experience and have successfully done so in prior roles
    • Have a propensity to notice things that need to be done and/or could be improved and take initiative to improve the situation
    • Have experience efficiently using G Suite, Zoom video, and Slack
    • Have strong written and oral communication
    • Are detail-oriented and “sweat the small stuff”
    • Have strong time management and organizational skills
    • Enjoy figuring things out on your own, but are willing to ask for help when you need it
    • Resonate with our mission, vision, and values

At Elevate Labs we value diversity and are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Apply for job

We have just opened up 500 spots nationally for experienced Medicare agents to join our platform by May 29th.Spots are filling up fast! COVID-19 is changing the way all Medicare is sold, but Assurance was built from the ground up as a next-generation solution for times like these.

 

Join the ASSURANCE platform, and take advantage of:

  • 100% remote;, you log in when you’re ready to sell.
  • Assurance pays both commissions and production bonuses. There are no caps on how much you can make, and top ASSURANCE agents earn over $200,000 in compensation annually.
  • Free calls via inbound shoppers generated from ASSURANCE-owned and operated websites, television commercials, and direct mail. Our Guides prospect calls and transfer interested and qualified prospect to you.
  • Access to our proprietary billion-dollar software platform at no cost to you. The platform has all the tools to empower you to succeed!
  • Contract with leading national carriers such as Humana, Aetna, UnitedHealthcare, and more.


You are in total control as you work remotely from the comfort of your home or office. Calls are always flowing on the ASSURANCE platform; when you log in you are put in front of interested consumers ready to talk to you. You’re not spending time prospecting and appointment setting, buying your own leads to dial, or sitting in a call center for 8 hours per day waiting for the phone to ring. You are your ownboss and you’re surrounded online by other top performers just like you.


The Assurance system has eliminated industry inefficiencies and will provide you with free training & scripting, back office accounting & customer service, tech support, recommendation and quoting engines, and custom analytics on your performance. Now you see why we were called “the Uber of insurance” when we were acquired by Prudential Financial (NYSE: PRU) for $3.5B in 2019.

Requirements to access ASSURANCE Medicare platform as 1 of 500 elite producers:

  • AHIP certification
  • 3+ insurance state licenses
  • High-speed Internet, reliable computer, and headset with microphone
  • History of compliant insurance sales practice

Medicare Insurance Agent – Industry-best comp plan, total work freedom

Join the revolutionary ASSURANCE platform, and earn from the industry’s best comp plan, selling trusted Medicare plans to inbound, in-market shoppers.

Get paid before, during, and after AEP. During AEP, we offer service fee commissions and bonuses, just for helping shoppers. Then after AEP, enjoy the largest January payout you’ve ever seen.

Work as an independent, remote, contract agent. Enjoy the freedom of working when you want, from wherever you want, helping inbound, qualified, in-market shoppers – all free to you.

Access our system, and eliminate agency inefficiencies and waste with free training, admin, support, product recommendations, and analytics. It’s like Uber for insurance!

After AEP, sell MediGap, health, or life, all year-round.

Join the ASSURANCE agent network, and take advantage of these benefits:

  • Free live, active, inbound shoppers generated from ASSURANCE-owned and operated sites
  • Access to our proprietary system (includes no dialing, product recommendations, analytics, and constant platform improvement), at no cost to you
  • Well-known and trusted carriers
  • 100s of Guides prospecting for you
  • Accessible underwriters
  • A+ BBB-accredited and proven

Requirements to access ASSURANCE platform:

  • AHIP certification
  • 12+ life insurance state licenses
  • One year of phone sales experience
  • High speed Internet connection, reliable computer, and headset with microphone
  • Thorough understanding of HIPAA privacy and security laws, DNC, and insurance regulatory laws
  • History of compliant insurance sales practice
  • Working space and equipment that comply with HIPAA privacy and security standards

About ASSURANCE:

Everyone is unique. But insurance plans are not.

Too often, plans offer blanket coverage, charging customers for coverage they don’t need while not offering enough of what they do.

ASSURANCE celebrates individual uniqueness with our personalized approach to seeking and purchasing insurance. Our platform serves as the intersection between customer and seller, technology and the human touch.

We start by asking customers a few questions to learn about their needs. From there, our ground-breaking, proprietary platform analyzes the thousands of data points that make customers unique. This is how we create custom-tailored plans for each and every kind of customer; plans built precisely for their needs and budget.

Our team of engineers, data scientists, marketers, architects, and designers are building systems using advanced science to make humans better. We’re eliminating insurance industry waste and simplifying the complex.

While our technology helps us personalize coverage, our network of experienced agents is how we deliver the right insurance to our customers.

All ASSURANCE Medicare agents are 1099, independent contractors and have maximum control over how, where, and when they do their work. ASSURANCE simply provides the tools to make your business as successful as possible.

Join ASSURANCE as we reimagine the role of insurance and enhance the personal and financial health of all consumers.

items.title: At Home Part-time Product Tester - $25-$45 hr.
items.content:
In-Home Usage Tester (Product Tester from home) Part-time

Presently we're recruiting Product Testers (from home) in several US cities to expand our private network of In-Home Usage Testers (IHUT) to fulfill upcoming contracts with national and international companies. We guarantee 15-20 hours per week with an hourly pay of between $25/hr. and $45/hr., depending on the In-Home Usage Test project. No experience required. 

American Consumer Panels® is a consulting firm that specializes in product testing and product development work. We design and conduct In-Home Usage Testing (IHUT) locally and nationally to provide actual user feedback to companies and market research firms to evaluate products, packaging, related product instructions and more. 

We leverage our network of private panels (In-Home Usage Testers) to provide product testers to companies for evaluating the in-home experience with a wide variety of products to ensure proper product certification and greater market access. 

Please note that although this job can be done from home 95% of the time, very occasionally In-Home Product Testers may be asked to visit the client's office, laboratory, store, warehouse or factory for training or meetings (visits are local and scheduled at no more than 20 minutes drive from the In-Home Usage Tester address). These optional visits are also paid by the hour. 

During your application process, we will determine your consumer profile and establish what products would be suitable for you to test according to your demographics, lifestyle, consumer behavior, skills, hobbies and ability. Research questionnaires are used to identify and target certain types of consumers, to ensure the right participants are engaged and to achieve the representative sample needed. Job candidates for In-Home Usage Testing are also screened to meet the client’s needs for the project to ensure that the product is one that they qualify to test and that they have a balance of demographics and attitudes. 

Participation in these product testing and consumer panels is always free, secure and private. In-Home Usage Testing is a quick, easy and fun way to make extra cash by telling big brands what you think about their upcoming products and services in the American market.


Main duties: 

  • Sign and return non-disclosure agreements before the product to be tested is shipped. Individuals who complete the required documents will have the products sent to their homes.
  • Once the product is received for In-Home Usage Test (IHUT), the Product Tester must take care of the product being tested and use it responsibly.
  • Read and strictly follow the In-Home Usage Test Daily Schedule provided with each product testing project. items.title: At Home Part-time Product Tester - $25-$45 hr.
items.content:
In-Home Usage Tester (Product Tester from home) Part-time

Presently we're recruiting Product Testers (from home) in several US cities to expand our private network of In-Home Usage Testers (IHUT) to fulfill upcoming contracts with national and international companies. We guarantee 15-20 hours per week with an hourly pay of between $25/hr. and $45/hr., depending on the In-Home Usage Test project. No experience required. 

American Consumer Panels® is a consulting firm that specializes in product testing and product development work. We design and conduct In-Home Usage Testing (IHUT) locally and nationally to provide actual user feedback to companies and market research firms to evaluate products, packaging, related product instructions and more. 

We leverage our network of private panels (In-Home Usage Testers) to provide product testers to companies for evaluating the in-home experience with a wide variety of products to ensure proper product certification and greater market access. 

Please note that although this job can be done from home 95% of the time, very occasionally In-Home Product Testers may be asked to visit the client's office, laboratory, store, warehouse or factory for training or meetings (visits are local and scheduled at no more than 20 minutes drive from the In-Home Usage Tester address). These optional visits are also paid by the hour. 

During your application process, we will determine your consumer profile and establish what products would be suitable for you to test according to your demographics, lifestyle, consumer behavior, skills, hobbies and ability. Research questionnaires are used to identify and target certain types of consumers, to ensure the right participants are engaged and to achieve the representative sample needed. Job candidates for In-Home Usage Testing are also screened to meet the client’s needs for the project to ensure that the product is one that they qualify to test and that they have a balance of demographics and attitudes. 

Participation in these product testing and consumer panels is always free, secure and private. In-Home Usage Testing is a quick, easy and fun way to make extra cash by telling big brands what you think about their upcoming products and services in the American market.


Main duties: 

  • Sign and return non-disclosure agreements before the product to be tested is shipped. Individuals who complete the required documents will have the products sent to their homes.
  • Once the product is received for In-Home Usage Test (IHUT), the Product Tester must take care of the product being tested and use it responsibly.
  • Read and strictly follow the In-Home Usage Test Daily Schedule provided with each product testing project. In-Home Usage Test Daily Schedules may include tasks to do such as: unpacking, reading instructions, journal entries, online or mobile feedback, usage of product for certain amount of time, writing reviews, taking pictures, etc.

  • Some In-Home Usage Tests projects may require participants to use MFour’s Mobile In-Home Use Test Technology (cutting edge smartphone technology to capture Point-of-Emotion® insights to gain unparalleled depth of responses).
  • Paid Product Testing is done from home 95% of the time, but very occasionally paid Product Testers may be asked to visit the client's office, laboratory, store, warehouse or factory for training or meetings. These visits are paid by the hour also.
  • There are times when the product testing may be discussed in a private chat room that is opened by the market research group.
  • Write reviews as requested in the In-Home Usage Test Daily Schedule for each project. 
  • Review requirements can vary, however, the standard requirement is a written review, photos of the reviewer with the product and a video review. 


Requirements:

  • Great ability to follow precise instructions
  • Be open to write short reviews, record audio or short video (doesn't have to be perfect), no experience needed
  • Great attention to detail and curious spirit
  • Be able to work 15-20 hours per week and commit to a certain routine

  • Have access to a digital camera or cellphone that takes pictures
  • Be honest and reliable

items.title: Manager, People & Culture
items.content:
Remote

Welcome to The Healthy Back Institute!

Here at the Healthy Back Institute we are on a mission to change the way people think about health and support people in their journey to live a pain free life. Over the years, we have literally helped millions of people live pain free, both safely and naturally. Everything that happens at the Healthy Back Institute is rooted in our core values: Helping People, Trust, Service, Family and Being Great! These are the foundations of how we serve our customers, as well as how we treat each other. Check out our reviews on Glassdoor to learn more about our unique culture!

Position Summary

The Manager of People and Culture position is full-time, remote position and reports directly to the COO, though of course, you will work very closely with the CEO and the rest of the Leadership team. We are a completely remote company made up of a diverse group of talented team members in many different geographical locations.

This is a truly dynamic role and perfect for someone that loves variety on a daily basis. As a highly collaborative and transparent organization, you will work closely with others at all levels of the company to provide an exceptional experience for both current team members, and applicants. This role is not for someone that prefers to be the visionary only, as you will be doing tactical work as well. If you love data, research and analytics you will get along great with our CEO. We are a highly data and research driven company and decisions based on a well researched plan is very meaningful for us.

Our HR is currently managed via a PEO and you will serve as liaison between our team and theirs. Our team is approximately 86 and we are growing rapidly so your excellent performance is required to ensure we continue to not only maintain our amazing culture and level of operations but also continue to optimize and improve both.

How you’ll make an impact:

This is a critical role at the Healthy Back Institute. This is a generalist role that will manage all components of the HR function.

HR / People / Culture Management

  • Serve as the primary human resources contact for all of our team members.
  • Further develop and optimize onboarding and new hire training process.
  • Manage and optimize employee engagement and satisfaction.
  • Standardize feedback and performance management process and assist team leaders in optimizing performance of all team members.
  • In partnership with Leaders, create learning and development plans for each team member to support their individual growth plans from a role specific, personal and professional perspective.
  • Work collaboratively with HBI’s Training Specialist to ensure full execution on Learning and Development training programs for new hires and current team members to upskill and/or reskill.
  • Take our existing healthy and strong culture and spread it deeper throughout the organization, our brand and into the marketplace.
  • Maintain and improve culture as we continue to grow.
  • Maintain and further enhance HBI’s Total Rewards strategy to include benefits administration, compensation analysis, recognition and rewards and performance management.
  • Lead the core people operations administrative functions to include team member relations, vendor relations with PEO, running payroll, administrative updates in PEO system, event coordination for company retreats and quarterly All Hands webinars, etc.

Talent Acquisition and Employer Branding

  • Own the full end to end recruiting process in partnership with Hiring Managers to create proactive, targeted talent acquisition strategies based on staffing needs of the department and organization. This includes all roles ranging from call center representatives to Executives and encompasses W2 employees, Contractors and freelancers.
  • Use our reputation in the job marketplace as a great place to work to build a larger and deeper pipeline of highly skilled and talented candidates.

Key experience that drives success in this role:

  • 3-5 years of HR Generalist experience in a small to mid-sized company that is rapidly growing.
  • Partnered in the build of innovative programs that have produced measurable results and lasting effects.
  • 2+ years of experience with development and execution of Learning and Developing training programs.
  • 2+ years performing the full cycle recruitment for a wide range of roles including call center representatives to Executives.
  • Experience navigating and fostering positive and productive relationships with vendors including PEO’s, HRIS account managers/business development, insurance brokers, etc.
  • Experience with HRIS implementations.
  • Working knowledge of state and legal regulations for a large number of states.
  • Well versed in the use of Technology including the entire Google Suite, HRIS software, Zoom, Slack, hosting webinars, etc.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Human Resources or Organizational Development.

Bonus if you are / have:

  • Experience working in the direct response marketing or e-commerce industry
  • Experience working in a completely remote company.
  • Utilizing skills testing, personality surveys and predictive hiring tools to drive better hiring decisions.
  • Managing a diverse group of team members including W2 employees, Contractors and freelancers.
  • PHR or SHRM-CP certifications are highly preferred, but not mandatory.

Benefits and Perks…Why Work Here?

  • A healthy work/life balance and flexible schedule
  • Remote / virtual work from home position
  • Medical, dental, vision insurance
  • 401K Retirement Plan
  • Life and disability insurance
  • Paid Time Off
  • Performance based bonuses
  • Discount on HBI products
  • An amazing team-centered culture felt at all levels of the company!
Apply for job

items.content:
Blue Canvas | Senior Engineer | Remote, SF, Berlin | https://bluecanvas.io

We make source control and DevOps tools for the Salesforce dev ecosystem. We were shocked to learn that Salesforce devs and admins build impressively complex applications without any kind of source control or CI! The market is growing fast as more companies embrace “low code” platforms like Salesforce ($13B was spent customizing Salesforce in 2017).

We’ve reached profitability working with initial customers like Twilio, McKesson and Intercom and recently raised a round from Indie.vc. We admire companies like Basecamp, Mailchimp and Atlassian who grew mostly with customer revenue AND made a significant impact.

We’re looking for experienced full-stack engineers to take a senior role working with our CTO. We are a remote-first company.

We're excited about you if you have experience in some of the following:

- Vue.js, Typescript, Apollo GraphQL - Python 3 - Ruby on Rails, GitLab - AWS, Terraform, Docker

Email jobs@bluecanvas.io if you're interested with the subject line "Interested in engineering at Blue Canvas"

items.content:
At You Intrapreneur (https://www.youintrapreneur.com/) we teach people how to become corporate entrepreneur to advance their career within their organization or outside their organization.


We want to build the workforce of the future raising CEO alike profiles who are able to lead at every level of their company, who have a broad range of competences, and can go deep and/or broad to solve problems and build solutions. 


Our students' motto is: "you don't need to be a CEO to work as a CEO!".


We are looking for a HR - Subject Matter Expert to build our HR chapter and improve our knowledge program.


This is a key chapter we want to develop to offer competitive advantage to our clients.


We want our clients to learn how HR teams identify emerging talent, what a "killer" personal brand is, how to best handle your compensations & benefits negotiation.


Responsibilities:



  • identify critical elements to know of a HR function and how to leverage those insights to get the most out of your career

  • identify business cases to facilitate the learning experience

  • summarize practical tips that you can share from your career experience in HR

  • write content material

  • work with the rest of the team to support with marketing activity (contribute to Webinars, articles, LinkedIn, etc)


What you'll have back:



  • the possibility to contribute developing future leaders and "give back" with your knowledge

  • you'll be part of a team, virtually meet other experts to expand your network

  • add a new experience on your CV and join our community of Advisers once everything goes back to normal

  • access coaching sessions for free


 


Please note this is a volunteer role for people in furlough

items.title: Technical Talent Specialist
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
WHAT WE WANT


UTOPICODE is currently looking for a specialist that is responsible for screening software developers on a technical level to meet the technical requirements of London’s tech companies. This profile would design and apply programming tests and tasks to validate the technical level of developers and ensure their seniority level.


 ABOUT THE COMPANY


 UTOPICODE is the platform that will transform the way remote tech talent is recruited. We want to be the first option for companies that wish to recruit remote and skilled tech talent from the LATAM region. UTOPICODE is an early-stage start-up and the founding team is currently developing the Minimum Viable Product to achieve product- market fit. Being part of the team at this early stage gives profiles the opportunity to have hands-on decision making within the company and great opportunities of career growth.


 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Design and perform live programming tests to evaluate fundamental computer science skills (i.e. data structures, algorithms etc.), software craftsmanship (i.e. understanding of unit testing, source control, APIs etc.), and/or specific technologies (i.e. iOS, distributed systems etc.)

  • Prepare task briefs for coding tests that show real challenges and practical problems that they would encounter in a company.

  • Observe the candidate’s logic, their ability to explain what they are doing, how they think and their ability to code under pressure.

  • Revise and screen developer’s repositories in their IDE’s (Integrated Development Environment)- GitHub, Google, Stack Overflow.

  • Perform pre-screening calls to analyse the developers’ technical knowledge and minutia.

  • Test different technical assessment platforms to analyse its integration to UTOPICODE’s recruiting tools.

  • Create and monitor the performance metrics of each candidate at a technical level.

  • Iterate technical assessments based on experience, developers feedback and customer’s needs.


OFFER



  • This position is paid by candidate’s examination.

  • This is a remote position with flexible office hours.

  • A cool workspace is provided at Google for Startups campus/ East London.


 REQUIREMENTS



  • Experienced full-stack developer.

  • Experience in designing and applying pre-screening tests for engineering teams.

  • Great communication skills.

  • Ability to empathize with candidates and provide feedback.

  • Flexibility and adaptability to changes implied in an early stage start-up environment.
